description: Borrowed from Latin complacēns (“very pleasing”), present participle of complacēre (“to please at the same time, be very pleasing”), from com- (“together”) + placēre (“to please”); see please and compare complaisant.

adjectives.description: complacent (comparative more complacent, superlative most complacent)

entries.meaning: Uncritically satisfied with oneself or one's achievements; smug.
Apathetic with regard to an apparent need or problem.
